title.narrative: Recife Swap Education and Public Management

description.narrative: The objective of the Project is to expand coverage of improved early child education (ECE), reduce age-grade distortion of students enrolled in the Borrowerâ€™s accelerated learning program, maintain lower dropout rates in full-time schools relative to the municipality average, and improve municipal public management, all within the Borrowerâ€™s territory.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements. Schedule 2. Section I.B.4. | Description :The MOR shall ensure that the budget codenumber indicated in the EEP table shall conform to the MOR'sannual budget law. The MOR and the Bank agree that such budget codenumber may change under the MOR'sbudget law provided, however, that there is no change in the corresponding EEP and in theunderlying activitiesto be financed by the Bank under such EEP. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements. Schedule 2. Section I.B.5. | Description :The MOR, though SEGESP, and the Bank mayjointly adjust, once every year, the amounts assigned per budgetcode to the EEPs, in a manner satisfactory to the Bank. |Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Implementation Arrangements. Schedule 2. Section I.B.6. | Description :Prior to the sixth disbursement underCategory (1), the MOR shall (i) carry out a mid-term review with theBank on the overall progress in the execution of the Projectand on the accomplishment of the Project, (ii)review whether adjustments or replacement of theexisting DLIs are needed, and (iii)thereafter make therequired adjustments, all in a manner acceptable to the Bank. | Due Date :04-May-2015

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements. Schedule 2. Section I.A. 1.(a) | Description :Create and maintain, until completionof the execution of theProject, an implementation unit within SEGESP, responsible for the overall implementation of the Project,with staff with qualifications and experience satisfactoryto the Bank including a Project coordinator, a deputy coordinator, aprocurement specialist, a financial management specialist, and other personnel needed. | Due Date :15-Jan-2013

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements. Schedule 2. Section I.A. 1.(b) | Description :Create and maintain, until completionof the execution of the Project, a ProjectConsultative Committee, responsible for overseeingimplementation, monitoring andevaluation of all Projectactivities and provide recommendations based on review of progress reportsand other relevantdocumentsprepared for the Project, and with structure and functions satisfactory to the Bank. | Due Date :15-Jan-2013

Finance Agreement :Project Monitoring. Safeguards. Schedule 2. Section I.D.1. | Description: The MOR shall, with the assistance ofthe pertinent participating entity, implement the Project in accordance with the provisions of the Policy Resettlement Framework(PRF) prepared by the MOR and approved by the Bank. | Frequency: Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Monitoring. Schedule 2. Section II.A.3. | Description :Select and contract an entity, independent fromthe MOR (Independent Verification Agency -IVA) with experience and qualifications in education acceptable to the Bank. The IVAshould be responsiblefor carrying out at least 2 technical audits during the Project, focused on compliance with theDLIs; (b)furnish to the Bank not later than the 6th & 11th Loan withdrawal, the two audit reports ofIVA. | Due Date :30-Sep-2013

Finance Agreement :Safeguards. Schedule 2. Section I.D.1. | Description :The MOR shall, with the assistance of the pertinentparticipating entity, implement the Project in accordancewith the provisions of the Environmental Management Framework (EMF) andthose of each environmentalmanagement plan required as per the terms of the EMF,prepared by the MOR and approved by the Bank. |Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Percentage of aggregate budget allocation for EEPs spent (DLI 1)

Municipal schools that receive systematic follow-up on a school management plan from the Core Regional Follow-up team (first number) [DLI 8] and of which municipal FTS (grades 6-9) that receive system
Students in grades 2-5 enrolled in accelerated learning program [DLI 15]
Impact evaluation of main education programs

target.value: Age-grade distortion correction program and FTS impact evaluation carried out and results presented by SEDUC

title.narrative: Maintain key staff during the Project implementation period. [DLI 12]
Learning assessment tests carried out in municipal schools in fundamental education and results disseminated at the school level* [DLI 19]

target.value: Results of 2016 State test dissemi-nated and 2017 State test carried out

title.narrative: Students enrolled in the accelerated learning program in grades 2-5 progressing two grades or more at the end of the school year
Difference in dropout rates between municipal full-time schools and the municipality average in low FE (grades 6-9)*
Civic engagement. Parents of children enrolled in newly built ECECs evaluating the service positively.
Students in grades 6-9 enrolled in accelerated learning program
Students in grades 6-9 enrolled in full-time schools [DLI 16]
Properties assessed and records updated in the new municipal real estate registration system from a selected metropolitan area in the municipality of Recifeâ€™s territory
Children enrolled in rehabilitated ECE and newly built/equipped ECECs
Principals and teachers from full-time schools (grades 6-9) participating in the new competency-based in-service training [DLI 17]
Teachers in rehabilitated ECE and ECECs who regularly participate in competency-based in-service training
Expansion of the IPTU tax base in a selected metropolitan area of 4,879 kmÂ² in the territory of Recife
Develop the Urban Restructuring and Economic Revitalization of the Territory of Recife, and Recife Urban Zoning Review

actual.value: Contract for the signing of the urban restructuring and economic revitalization study is on-going.
